title: We need instructions for using X11 fonts.
body:
I built R with Spack's X11 libraries and everything seemed ok.

Then I ran this little snippet

``` R
png('moose.png')
boxplot(mpg~cyl,data=mtcars, main="Car Milage Data", xlab="Number of Cylinders", ylab="Miles Per Gallon")
dev.off()
```

and it generated a PNG file for me without any complaints.

But when scp'ed the file to my mac and opened  it, I discovered that all of the characters in the axes and labels  and ... had been replaced by little unfilled rectanges (presumably their bounding boxes).

I hadn't installed any fonts, so I put together this script:

``` sh
#!/bin/sh

spack install font-util
spack install encodings
spack install font-adobe-100dpi
spack install font-adobe-75dpi
spack install font-adobe-utopia-100dpi
spack install font-adobe-utopia-75dpi
spack install font-adobe-utopia-type1
spack install font-alias
spack install font-arabic-misc
spack install font-bh-100dpi
spack install font-bh-75dpi
spack install font-bh-lucidatypewriter-100dpi
spack install font-bh-lucidatypewriter-75dpi
spack install font-bh-ttf
spack install font-bh-type1
spack install font-bitstream-100dpi
spack install font-bitstream-75dpi
spack install font-bitstream-type1
spack install font-cronyx-cyrillic
spack install font-cursor-misc
spack install font-daewoo-misc
spack install font-dec-misc
spack install font-ibm-type1
spack install font-isas-misc
spack install font-jis-misc
spack install font-micro-misc
spack install font-misc-cyrillic
spack install font-misc-ethiopic
spack install font-misc-meltho
spack install font-misc-misc
spack install font-mutt-misc
spack install font-schumacher-misc
spack install font-screen-cyrillic
spack install font-sony-misc
spack install font-sun-misc
spack install font-winitzki-cyrillic
spack install font-xfree86-type1
```

These died with an assertion in database.py (#2139), but the rest installed.

```
font-adobe-utopia-type1
font-bitstream-type1
font-ibm-type1
font-misc-ethiopic
font-misc-meltho
font-xfree86-type1
```

Simply install'ing them didn't do anything useful (still got bounding boxes instead of glyphs), but that's not surprising.  Then I set to figuring out how to make X aware of them.

I ended up doing:

```
module load fontconfig
mkdir -p ~/.config/fontconfig/
vi ~/.config/fontconfig/fonts.conf
fc-cache -f
```

with a fonts.conf that looked like so:

``` xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
      <!DOCTYPE fontconfig SYSTEM "fonts.dtd">
      <fontconfig>
        <dir>/rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/font-util-1.3.1-6rs7qlybxshfpui546rmxoeuxkahypbv/share/fonts/X11</dir>
      </fontconfig>
```

and my PNG image had glyphs instead of bounding boxes.

The glyphs were ugly/jaggy, presumably I need to turn on anti-aliasing somewhere.

It would be nice to have some instructions about how this is supposed to work.  I'm clearly flying a bit blind, but am happy to wordsmith.
